title: `transmute_copy` incorrect size assertion
body:
This commit https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/5f5ca889589c24a12864329c027db431adbc7fae added a size assertion to `transmute_copy` that asserts `cannot transmute_copy if U is larger than T`, but the assertion is actually invoked if `Src` is larger or **equal** to `Dst`. ```rust assert!(size_of::() >= size_of::(), "cannot transmute_copy if U is larger than T"); ``` I tried this code: I was using the `enigo` crate, internally it `transmute_copy`'s some winapi structs. ```rust INPUT { type_: INPUT_KEYBOARD, u: unsafe { transmute_copy(&KEYBDINPUT { wVk: vk, wScan: scan, dwFlags: flags, time: 0, dwExtraInfo: 0, }) }, }; ``` I expected to see this happen: `transmute_copy` should work on types of equal sizes. Instead, this happened: Function asserted. --------- Sidenote, the docs should probably also be changed, as they state ``` This function triggers [undefined behavior][ub] if `U` is larger than `T`. ``` but the real outcome is an assert.
Backtrace

``` thread 'main' panicked at 'cannot transmute_copy if U is larger than T', /rustc/897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120\library\core\src\mem\mod.rs:1057:5 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic_handler at /rustc/897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120/library\std\src\panicking.rs:584 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120/library\core\src\panicking.rs:142 2: core::mem::transmute_copy at /rustc/897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120\library\core\src\mem\mod.rs:1057 3: enigo::win::win_impl::keybd_event at C:\Users\sam.mackenzie\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\enigo-0.0.14\src\win\win_impl.rs:36 4: enigo::win::win_impl::Enigo::unicode_key_down at C:\Users\sam.mackenzie\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\enigo-0.0.14\src\win\win_impl.rs:191```
